data.reasoning: Based on the menu, this restaurant poses a significant risk to individuals with celiac disease. Many items are fried, indicating a high probability of shared fryers and cross-contamination. Lo Mein dishes contain wheat noodles. Soy sauce, a common ingredient in Chinese cuisine, often contains wheat. There is no mention of gluten-free options or dedicated preparation areas. The rule-based analysis found no helpful indicators, further lowering confidence. While some steamed dishes are listed, without confirmation of gluten-free soy sauce and preparation methods, they cannot be considered definitively safe.
risk_factors: Use of soy sauce (likely containing wheat)
Egg rolls, Spring Rolls, Fried Wontons all contain wheat
Most sauces are likely thickened with wheat flour/cornstarch
safe_alternatives: Steamed dishes with brown sauce on the side (verify gluten-free soy sauce)
Vegetable Mei Fun or Chow Fun (only if rice noodles are prepared separately and cross-contamination is avoided, and soy sauce is gluten-free)
